name: commensurable
content:
commensurable adjective
(COMPARABLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal able to be judged by the same measure or standard: Aristotle himself did not believe that all valuable things are commensurable. commensurable with Culture today is not commensurable with culture as we understood it a few years ago.
More examplesFewer examplesThey should be getting, if not the same salary and benefits as their peers, at least something commensurable.She is highly regarded, and her boyfriend is a star of commensurable brightness in his own field.

commensurable adjective
(IN MATHEMATICS)
mathematics
  specialized able to be divided by the same unit: He was a Greek mathematician who discovered that some numbers are not commensurable. Forces in Newtonian physics are measurable, commensurable, and conclusive.
